casebody.data:
Joseph Upper, appellant, and Ashbel Green, receiver &c., respondent. On appeal from a decree of the chancellor, whose opinion is reported in North River Construction Co.’s Case, 11 Stew. Eq. 433. Mr. F. W. Stevens, for appellant, cited:

Rev. 188; Del., Lack. & West. R. R. Co. v. Oxford Iron Co., 6 Stew. Eq. 192; Bedford v. Newark Machine Co., 1 C. E. Gr. 120; Story’s Eq. Jur. § 1047; Adams’s Eq. Jur. *54; Receivers of New Jersey Midland Co. v. Wortendyke, 12 C. E. Gr. 660; Coe v. Midland Railway Co., 4 Stew. Eq. 105; Shinn v. Budd, 1 McCart. 234; Sheldon on Subrogation § 246; Hoover v. Epler, 52 Pa. St. 522; Abbott v. Balt. & Rap. Steam Packet Co., 4 Md. Ch. 317; Cottrill’s Appeal, 11 Pa. St. 294; Guns v. Theime, 93 N. F. 228; Tradesmen’s Building Assn. v. Thompson, 5 Stew. Eq. 133.

Hon. John P. Stockton, Attorney-General, for respondent. Per Curiam.

This decree affirmed for the reasons given by the chancellor.

*341For affirmance — The Chief-Justice, Depue, Magie, Reed, Scudder, Van Syokel, Brown, Cole, McGregor, Whitake® — 10. For reversal — Dixon, Clement, Paterson — 3.
